intro: Rhytachne gonzalezii, commonly known as the Gonzalez's rhytachne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in countries like Guatemala and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its small, elongated leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and relatively understudied species.
